subproject.description:
The proposed outcomes of the project are as follows:
1) Create greater awareness of the disaster agency and its role and functions.
2) Sensitize the community to the fact that Trinidad and Tobago is vulnerable to hazards other than hurricanes and flooding.
3) To reduce the vulnerability of the public to the impact of various hazards.
4) To link disaster management to sustainable development-  showing that there is a connection between the two and why disaster management should be integrated into development planning.

The project attempts to accomplish these objectives through the production of two (2) DVDs that would explore the role and function of the Office of Disaster and Preparedness Management (ODPM) as well as highlight the hazards that are specific to both islands. Thses DVDs would be broadcasted in mainstream media as a public relations tool and be targerted to such groups as schools, community based groups, faith based groups, private sector companies, and critical agencies (e.g. the Trinidad and Tobago Fire Services; the Trinidad and Tobago Police Service; Regional Corporations).
subproject.title: Disaster Risk Reduction

title: Disaster Risk Reduction in  Most Vulnerable Communities
